results.name: Alternating sum of balanced ternary digits in n. Replace 3^k with (-1)^k in balanced ternary expansion of n.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Array[Total@ MapIndexed[#1 (2 Mod[First[#2], 2] - 1) &, Reverse@ #] &[Prepend[IntegerDigits[#, 3], 0] //. {a___, b_, 2, c___} :> {a, b + 1, -1, c}] &, 104] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jun 27 2020 *)
